content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is a function in Julia that should accomplish the task:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    blocks = filter(x -> occursin("```julia", x) && occursin("```", x), split(md, "```"))
    code_blocks = map(x -> replace(x, "```" => ""), blocks)
    return join(code_blocks, "\n\n")
end
```

This function works by first splitting the markdown string on `"```"` to separate the code blocks. It then filters out any blocks that don't have both "```julia" and "```", ensuring we're only looking at Julia code blocks. The `map` function is used to remove the code fences from the remaining blocks. Finally, `join` is used to combine all the code blocks into a single string, separated by two newlines.
